title: Automatic Compositor Attribution in the First Folio of Shakespeare
authors:
Ryskina, Maria  and
Alpert-Abrams, Hannah  and
Garrette, Dan  and
Berg-Kirkpatrick, Taylor
venue: Proceedings of the 55th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 2: Short Papers)
abstract: Compositor attribution, the clustering of pages in a historical printed document by the individual who set the type, is a bibliographic task that relies on analysis of orthographic variation and inspection of visual details of the printed page. In this paper, we introduce a novel unsupervised model that jointly describes the textual and visual features needed to distinguish compositors. Applied to images of Shakespeareâ€™s First Folio, our model predicts attributions that agree with the manual judgements of bibliographers with an accuracy of 87%, even on text that is the output of OCR.
